ko: 내가 말한 것들은 다 내 경험에서 나온 거야.

en: Frustrated with the European languages, which he considered "too boring", Christopher Columbus invented "Columbian", a language so complicated that only he could speak it.
ko: 유럽 언어들이 너무 지루하다고 생각한 크리스토퍼 콜럼버스는 자기만 말할 수 있는 아주 복잡한 '콜럼버스어'를 만들었어.

en: Where were you born?
My last name is Wang.
My surname is Wan.
My surname is 'Wang.'
I won't pay 40 dollars for just one book.
My mother set the table.
A trip by boat takes more time than one by car.
ko: 배 타고 가는 게 차 타고 가는 것보다 시간 더 걸려.

en: He was an excellent student, so far as I'm aware.
Why are you crying, my beloved?
I am disillusioned with you.
He's always at odds with his boss.
He wanted to get my phone number.
ko: 걔가 내 번호 따고 싶어 했어.

en: This ticket is valid for two days after purchase.
ko: 이 티켓은 사고 나서 이틀 동안 쓸 수 있어.

en: They are selling fish and meat.
Some creationists believe that Adam and Eve had no navels, and that the trees in the Garden of Eden had no growth rings.
ko: 어떤 창조론자들은 아담과 하와한테 배꼽이 없었고, 에덴동산 나무들에는 나이테가 없었다고 믿어.

en: Because of everyone's correct-mindedness, the rain stopped on the morning of the match day.
ko: 모두의 정성 덕분인지 경기 당일 아침에 비가 그쳤어.

en: We eat here.
She gets prettier day by day.
There are more sweets in this shop than in that one.
ko: 이 가게에 저 가게보다 과자가 더 많아.

en: When they hear 'Japanese-style room,' most people probably think of a tatami room.
ko: 일본식 방이라고 하면 보통 다다미방을 떠올릴 거야.

en: She's not here to defend herself against these accusations.
ko: 걔는 이런 비난에 맞서 스스로를 변호하려고 여기 있는 게 아니야.

en: Their meeting was inevitable.
I've always thought that rickshaws and sukiyaki were the most successful amongst the products made from what was imported from the West during the Meiji period.
ko: 난 메이지 시대 때 서양에서 들여온 걸로 만든 것 중에서 인력거랑 스키야키가 제일 성공한 거라고 늘 생각해왔어.

en: This is not a sentence.
It isn't possible to clear the snow from every road.
ko: 모든 길의 눈을 다 치우는 건 불가능해.

en: Come quickly.
We lost sight of them over half an hour ago.
Lord Jesus Christ in heaven, please protect me.
ko: 하늘에 계신 주 예수 그리스도님, 저를 지켜주세요.

en: I go to the bazaar every Sunday afternoon.

When two armies oppose one another, those who can fight should fight, those who can't fight should guard, those who can't guard should flee, those who can't flee should surrender, and those who can't surrender should die.
ko: 두 군대가 맞붙었을 때, 싸울 수 있는 자는 싸우고, 못 싸우는 자는 지키고, 못 지키는 자는 도망치고, 못 도망치는 자는 항복하고, 항복 못 하는 자는 죽어야 해.

en: Look! The train has arrived!
I can't remember.
I don't remember.
We drank shochu at the karaoke bar.
Why did you lie?
Myanmar is ruled by a military dictatorship.
ko: 미얀마는 군사 독재 정권이 다스리고 있어.

en: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
ko: 여호와는 나의 목자시니 내게 부족함이 없으리로다.

en: Selena Gomez was named after the Tejano singer Selena.
ko: 셀레나 고메즈는 테하노 가수 셀레나의 이름을 따서 지었대.

en: In 2009, Selena Gomez became the youngest person to be named a United Nations Children's Fund Ambassador in the United States.
ko: 2009년에 셀레나 고메즈는 미국에서 최연소 유니세프 친선 대사가 됐어.

en: For how long have you been studying Esperanto?
All the sweet talk was just a ruse to get her into bed.
ko: 그 달콤한 말들은 다 걔랑 자보려고 한 수작이었어.

en: The book was published in 1689.
In the U.S., they often mistake me for a Chinese person.
ko: 미국에서는 사람들이 날 종종 중국인으로 착각해.

en: It is very interesting to learn Esperanto.
Bananas are yellow.
The dog is smart.
Dogs are smart.
Satoru is the fastest runner out of the five of us.
ko: 사토루가 우리 다섯 명 중에서 제일 빨라.

en: The Shinanogawa river is the longest river in Japan.
What is the tallest mountain in Europe?
What's the tallest mountain in Europe?
Takada is the richest out of all of us.
Miho plays the piano better than Noriko.
ko: 미호가 노리코보다 피아노를 더 잘 쳐.

en: Miho plays piano better than Noriko.
ko: 미호가 노리코보다 피아노 더 잘 쳐.

en: The sunset is soon.
It'll soon be sunset.
The sun will soon set.
Did you eat lunch?
Has your father arrived yet?
After that, I'll leave for Saigon.
I'm flying to Hanoi tomorrow.
The moon is pretty in the fall.
Some programmers seem to forget that writing good documentation is as important, if not more important, as writing a good program.
ko: 어떤 개발자들은 좋은 문서를 쓰는 게 좋은 프로그램을 만드는 것만큼, 아니 어쩌면 그보다 더 중요하다는 걸 잊는 것 같아.

en: How much is a beer?
Wipe your tears.
London is their second home.

Everyone is entitled to all the rights and freedoms set forth in this Declaration, without distinction of any kind, such as race, colour, sex, language, religion, political or other opinion, national or social origin, property, birth or other status.
ko: 모든 사람은 인종, 피부색, 성별, 언어, 종교, 정치적 견해, 국적이나 사회적 신분, 재산, 출생 등 어떤 차별도 없이 이 선언에 담긴 모든 권리와 자유를 누릴 자격이 있어.

en: Furthermore, no distinction shall be made on the basis of the political, jurisdictional or international status of the country or territory to which a person belongs, whether it be independent, trust, non-self-governing or under any other limitation of sovereignty.
ko: 게다가 어떤 사람이 속한 나라나 지역이 독립국인지, 신탁 통치 지역인지, 비자치 지역인지, 혹은 어떤 주권 제약 아래 있든지 그 나라의 정치적, 사법적, 국제적 지위를 바탕으로 차별을 두어서는 안 돼.

en: Everyone has the right to life, liberty and the security of person.
ko: 모든 사람은 생명권과 자유, 그리고 신체의 안전을 누릴 권리가 있어.

en: No one shall be subjected to torture or to cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment.
ko: 누구도 고문이나 잔인하고 비인도적인, 혹은 굴욕적인 대우나 처벌을 받아서는 안 돼.

en: My daughter caught a cold.
How did you learn about that news?
I want to visit Korea.
I want to visit South Korea.
That book is thick, but it's not very expensive.
ko: 그 책은 두꺼운데 별로 안 비싸.

en: His birthday is May 5th.
I wonder what I should get you for your birthday.
ko: 생일 선물로 뭐 사줄까 고민 중이야.

en: Man plans things, but the gods decide.
ko: 계획은 사람이 세워도 결과는 하늘에 달렸어.

en: My coworker really knows how to suck up to the boss.
ko: 내 직장 동료는 상사한테 아부 떠는 데 진짜 선수야.

en: When did you come back from London?
They speak English in Australia.
He took a book from the bookshelf.
ko: 걔가 책꽂이에서 책 한 권을 꺼냈어.

en: Ask only "yes" or "no" questions.
ko: 예 아니오로만 대답할 수 있는 질문만 해.

en: What is this bird called?
Italian is my mother tongue.
Shit, I blew a fuse!
Wise men talk about ideas, intellectuals about facts, and the ordinary man talks about what he eats.
ko: 현자는 아이디어를 논하고, 지식인은 사실을 논하고, 보통 사람은 먹는 얘기나 해.

en: This is my sister.
Why did you decide to affiliate yourself with Company A?
ko: 왜 A 회사랑 같이 일하기로 했어?

en: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
ko: 재빠른 갈색 여우가 게으른 개를 뛰어넘어.

en: I love to hear a grandfather clock chime.
ko: 난 괘종시계 종소리 듣는 게 참 좋더라.

en: I've tried calling him all day, but the line is busy.
ko: 하루 종일 걔한테 전화해봤는데 계속 통화 중이야.

en: Please do not forget.
This is a car.
I write everything down; I feel uneasy without my notebook.
ko: 난 뭐든 다 적어 놔. 수첩 없으면 불안하거든.

en: I have time, so I'll do it.
I've been thinking about it the entire day.
Good people can be found anywhere.
He threw everything out of the boat.
ko: 걔가 배에 있는 걸 다 밖으로 던져버렸어.

en: Look at what she brought for my birthday party!
ko: 걔가 내 생일 파티에 뭐 가져왔는지 좀 봐!

en: I prefer milk to juice.
I'm dubious about claims to speak more than five languages fluently.
ko: 5개 국어 넘게 유창하게 한다는 말은 좀 의심스러워.

en: The wedding will be held in a 17th century church.
Your shoes are untied.
I got a piece of lead for my mechanical pencil from her.
A child of just five was hit by a bicycle.
ko: 겨우 다섯 살 된 애가 자전거에 치였어.

en: At that time, bicycles were just starting to get popular and, here and there, there were many unskilled beginners who ran into people and broke through their hedges.
ko: 그 당시에는 자전거가 막 유행하기 시작해서, 여기저기서 사람을 치거나 울타리를 부수고 들어가는 서툰 초보자들이 많았어.

en: I'm back.
The Devil made me do it.
A long time ago, around here, a nice schoolteacher called Matsumoto tried to rescue one of his pupils, but on the contrary he ended up drowning.
ko: 옛날에 이 근처에서 마츠모토라는 착한 선생님이 제자를 구하려다 그만 본인이 물에 빠져 돌아가셨대.

en: The locals call this river the man-eating river and fear it.
ko: 동네 사람들은 이 강을 식인 강이라고 부르면서 무서워해.

en: Don't make promises that you cannot keep.
Today Maral became one year old.
Coming to school in your pajamas, how lazy!
ko: 잠옷 입고 학교에 오다니, 진짜 게으르다!

en: The plane arrived exactly at nine.
It seems that Ali is very interested in Myrmecology.
ko: 알리는 개미학에 관심이 아주 많은 것 같아.

en: It's a peacock. It was a peacock that cried just now.
Yikes!
I'm wondering what will happen if I push this button.
ko: 이 버튼 누르면 어떻게 될지 궁금해.

en: I once saw a man walk barefoot over hot coals.
ko: 어떤 사람이 뜨거운 숯 위를 맨발로 걷는 걸 본 적 있어.

en: This algorithm doesn't converge.
Kiss me.
Young man, enjoy yourself while you are young!
Time is money.
I couldn't find the page I was looking for.
We were unable to find the webpage that you requested.
We are the people.
This is the cheapest shop in town.
ko: 여기가 이 동네에서 제일 싼 가게야.

en: My name is Sasha.
I am a student in a university.
You've got dark circles under your eyes.
You've got bags under your eyes.
Please introduce yourself, sir. What's your profession?
ko: 자기소개 좀 부탁드릴게요. 직업이 어떻게 되세요?

en: Welcome to the Tatoeba Project website.
ko: 타토에바 프로젝트 웹사이트에 오신 걸 환영해요.

en: Welcome to Tatoeba!
You can add sentences that you do not know how to translate. Perhaps someone else will know.
ko: 어떻게 번역할지 모르는 문장들을 추가해도 돼. 아마 다른 누군가가 알 거야.

en: Do you like white chocolate?
High calorie foods are bad for my health.
There are about seven billion people in the world.
Masha didn't know her parents.
There are more important things in life.
Long live the Emperor!
How many friends do you have?
How are things at work?
Do you have plans for tonight?
What are you doing right now?
I'm glad to have been invited to dinner.
She's wearing a hat.
Some people do not have a consistent set of principles; they just adopt whatever principles benefit them at the moment.
ko: 어떤 사람들은 일관된 원칙이 없어. 그냥 그때그때 자기한테 유리한 원칙을 따를 뿐이야.

en: There remain approximately 900 art sketches by Leonardo da Vinci.
ko: 레오나르도 다빈치의 스케치 작품이 약 900점 정도 남아 있어.

en: Each person paid $7,000.
She wore her hair in plaits.
The English language is undoubtedly the easiest and at the same time the most efficient means of international communication.
ko: 영어는 확실히 가장 쉬우면서도 동시에 가장 효율적인 국제 소통 수단이야.

en: He passed away yesterday.
He deceased yesterday.
He passed on yesterday.
How do you say 'a cat' in Hebrew?
My dream is to go to Japan someday.
ko: 내 꿈은 언젠가 일본에 가는 거야.

en: Today I'm lacking inspiration.
He grabbed her hand.
Spring will be here soon.

When I was very young, my father died. His younger brother, due to the vicissitudes of the times and to his own laziness, dissipated his own fortune and afterwards became a peddler of writing materials. He often came to our house, but when he came, my mother would scold him and he would be troubled.
ko: 내가 아주 어릴 때 아버지가 돌아가셨어. 작은아버지는 시대의 풍파와 본인의 게으름 때문에 재산을 탕진하고 나중에는 필기구 장수가 되셨지. 우리 집에 자주 오셨는데, 오실 때마다 어머니가 꾸짖으셔서 난처해하곤 하셨어.

en: I don't remember having had any toys when I was young.
ko: 어릴 때 장난감을 가지고 놀았던 기억이 없어.

en: Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn.
ko: 솔직히 말해서, 내 알 바 아니야.

en: In elementary school, I was a prodigy and I was mostly the first or second best student in my class.
ko: 초등학교 때는 신동 소리 들으면서 거의 반에서 1, 2등만 했어.

en: When I think about it now, our family lived a very miserable life.
ko: 지금 생각해보면 우리 가족은 정말 비참하게 살았어.

en: I said that I don't remember having had any toys, and I also don't remember having had any snacks.
ko: 장난감도 없었지만 간식도 먹어본 기억이 없어.

en: I had no toys or anything else, so I used a chalk that had been bought for me and drew pictures and letters on a closet door.
ko: 장난감 같은 게 전혀 없어서 사다 주신 분필로 옷장 문에 그림이랑 글자를 그리곤 했어.

en: I see dead people.
My wife gave birth to a child when we were very poor. While she was sleeping, I cooked rice and vegetables for several days and surprised her with the variety and taste of my cooking.
ko: 우리 진짜 가난할 때 아내가 아이를 낳았어. 아내가 자는 동안 내가 며칠 동안 밥이랑 반찬을 만들었는데, 요리 가짓수랑 맛으로 아내를 깜짝 놀라게 해줬지.

en: I had resolved to steal one yen to go see it, but we were poor and there was no way I would find one yen to steal around our house.
ko: 그걸 보러 가려고 1엔을 훔치기로 결심했는데, 집이 너무 가난해서 훔칠 1엔조차 없었어.

en: When I was in elementary school I thought, from the bottom of my heart, that the teachers were great people and I was influenced by the teachers' attitudes and moral lessons, but middle school was just a business like any other.
ko: 초등학교 때는 선생님들이 정말 훌륭한 분들이라고 진심으로 믿었고 선생님들의 태도와 도덕 교육에 영향을 많이 받았는데, 중학교는 그냥 다른 사업체랑 다를 바 없더라고.

en: Once, when I went to my friend Kawai's house, he fired a pistol. He thought it was not loaded and pointed it at my mouth, but it was and the bullet grazed my ear before hitting the closet.
ko: 한번은 친구 카와이네 집에 갔는데 걔가 권총을 쐈어. 총알이 없는 줄 알고 내 입에 겨누고 쐈는데, 알고 보니 총알이 들어있어서 내 귀를 스치고 옷장에 박혔어.

en: I wanted to become a philosopher.
It's a lot easier to fall in love than to stay in love.
ko: 사랑에 빠지는 건 사랑을 유지하는 것보다 훨씬 쉬워.

en: Wait, don't shoot!
A cat abhors a vacuum.
Cats hate vacuum cleaners.
It's nice out today, and will be tomorrow as well.
ko: 오늘 날씨 좋네, 내일도 좋을 거야.

en: It was a terrible affair.
I hate Mondays.

Me and my colleagues lived in a small 2 room cabin built on the edge of a cliff on the mountain. I say 2 rooms, but besides the entrance, there was a 6 by 2 tatami room. We ate potatoes, dried fish and tofu. Because we were on the top of a cold mountain, the potatoes would freeze during the winter.
ko: 나랑 동료들은 산 절벽 끝에 지어진 작은 오두막에서 살았어. 방이 두 개라고는 해도 현관 말고는 다다미 6장짜리랑 2장짜리 방이 다였지. 우리는 감자랑 말린 생선, 두부를 먹었는데, 추운 산꼭대기라 겨울에는 감자가 다 얼어버리곤 했어.

en: What's done is done.
Regardless how loud you scream "Oo-oo!", you won't turn into a wolf.
ko: 아무리 크게 "아우우!" 하고 울부짖어도 늑대로 변하진 않아.

en: He who wounds by the sword, dies by the sword.
ko: 칼로 흥한 자는 칼로 망하는 법이야.

en: Now this is something. What wonderful presents! Boy am I happy!
ko: 와, 이거 대단한데. 정말 멋진 선물들이야! 너무 행복해!

en: In Australia, English is spoken.
Uyghur is a Turkic language.
The train seems to be late.
Every morning, I go shopping.
The story of a great flood is very common in world mythology.
ko: 대홍수 이야기는 세계 신화에서 아주 흔해.

en: Don't be ridiculous!
It's complicated as hell.
"When do you get up?" "At 8 in the morning."
It's dangerous to talk on the phone and drive at the same time.
Brilliant people have one major drawback - they don't know how to lose.
ko: 똑똑한 사람들은 큰 단점이 하나 있는데, 지는 법을 모른다는 거야.

en: Four times five is 20.
I'm waiting for someone.
I need help.
It's okay if you go in there and take a seat.
She doesn't have a driver's license.
If you're bored, you can contribute to Tatoeba.
I want you only when you're not there.
ko: 너 없을 때만 네가 보고 싶어.

en: Do not translate this sentence!
Hell is other people.
Others are hell.
She looks tired.
I'm already full, thank you.
Justin Bieber is more famous than Katie Holmes.
ko: 저스틴 비버가 케이티 홈즈보다 더 유명해.

en: He works as a translator.
Though he is no longer president, he still holds considerable sway among the political elite.
ko: 이제 대통령은 아니지만, 여전히 정치권에서 영향력이 대단해.
